questionTitle: The large compound eyes of the dragonfly ___ to see moving objects almost eighteen feet away.
Adhesive, such as glue, tape, and gum, vary with the purpose ___ intended.
In the Osage tribe of Oklahoma, beaded belts _____ who held a high social status.
The wood of the holly tree, close-grained and very hard, _____ for musical instruments, furniture, and interior design.
Because its leaves remain green long after being picked, rosemary ___ associated with the idea of remembrance.
It was proposed by the new member on the committee that membership fees ________ reduced.
Small microcomputers of today can process ________ their predecessors, which were twenty times their size.
anwers: in the same amount of information
and have the same amount of information
the information is the same as
the same amount of information as

questionTitle: The total production of bushels of corn in the United States is ________ all other cereal crops combined.

________ the fifth largest among the nine planets that make up our solar system.
In carpentry, ________ "ceiling joists" refers to boards hung down from unfinished ceilings as the backbone from which finishing materials can be hung.
